jchrest.architecture

Class Chrest

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • jchrest.architecture.Chrest

  • public class Chrest
extends java.util.Observable
    A CHREST model.

    All times are specified in milliseconds.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Chrest

        public Chrest(int time,
              boolean learnObjectLocationsRelativeToAgent)
        The domain that the Chrest model exists in is set to be a GenericDomain initially and should be modified, if necessary, after the Chrest model has been constructed (see setDomain(jchrest.domainSpecifics.DomainSpecifics)).
        Parameters:
        time -
        learnObjectLocationsRelativeToAgent - When the Perceiver associated with #this generates new Modality.VISUAL ListPatterns from Scenes or when Modality.VISUAL ListPatterns stored in long-term memory are used to suggest new Fixations, this variable controls whether the column and row coordinates of Squares are absolute or relative to the agent that equipped with this Chrest model. Consider the following Scene ("SELF" denotes the agent equipped with this Chrest model, "OO" denotes a SceneObject): 

         Row
    |----|----|----|
  2 |    |    |    |
    |----|----|----|
  1 |    |SELF|    |
    |----|----|----|
  0 |    |    | OO |
    |----|----|----|
      0     1    2    Col

        If this variable is set to Boolean.TRUE and the agent is to learn the location of "OO", the ListPattern generated and (potentially) memorised would be: <[OO, 1, -1]> ("OO" is 1 square east and 1 square south of the agent's location). If this variable were set to Boolean.FALSE, the ListPattern generated and (potentially) memorised would be: <[OO, 2, 0]> (column and row coordinates are domain-specific, i.e. absolute).

        If this parameter is set to Boolean.TRUE, the agent equipped with this Chrest model must identify itself in all Scenes generated and used (see Scene.getCreatorToken()).

      • setLtmLinkTraversalTime

        public void setLtmLinkTraversalTime(int time)
        Sets the time taken to traverse a Link during recogniseAndLearn(jchrest.lib.ListPattern, int) and recognise(jchrest.lib.ListPattern, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.Boolean). Set to 10ms by default: see table 8.2 found in "Perception and Memory in Chess" by de Groot and Gobet.
        Parameters:
        time - Should be >= 0.

      • setMaximumSemanticLinkSearchDistance

        public void setMaximumSemanticLinkSearchDistance(int maximumSemanticLinkSearchDistance)
        Sets the number of semantic links that can be followed from a Node reached after sorting a ListPattern "vertically" through the long-term memory of this Chrest model. For example, if 3 Nodes are semantically linked: 1 -> 2 -> 3, the maximum semantic link search distance is set to 1 and Node 1 is retrieved after sorting a ListPattern "vertically" through long-term memory, Node 2 would be retrieved. Set to 1 by default.
        Parameters:
        maximumSemanticLinkSearchDistance - Should be >= 0.

      • setNodeComparisonTime

        public void setNodeComparisonTime(int time)
        Sets the time taken to compare two Nodes during short/long-term memory operations. Set to 50ms by default: see table 8.2 found in "Perception and Memory in Chess" by de Groot and Gobet.
        Parameters:
        time - Should be >= 0.

      • setNodeImageSimilarityThreshold

        public void setNodeImageSimilarityThreshold(int threshold)
        Controls whether a semantic link can be created between two Nodes when recognise(jchrest.lib.ListPattern, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.Boolean) or recogniseAndLearn(jchrest.lib.ListPattern, int) is invoked. Node image similarity is based upon how many PrimitivePatterns are shared by the images of two Nodes.

        Set to 4 by default.

        Parameters:
        threshold - Should be >= 0.

      • setReinforceProductionTime

        public void setReinforceProductionTime(int time)
        Set to 50ms by default.
        Parameters:
        time - Should be >= 0

      • setRho

        public void setRho(float rho)
        Sets the likelihood that this Chrest model will not randomly refuse to learn (see recogniseAndLearn(jchrest.lib.ListPattern, int). Set to 1.0 by default, i.e. this Chrest model will never randomly refuse to learn.
        Parameters:
        rho - Should be greater than/equal to 0.0 and less than/equal to 1.0. The lower the value, the more likely this Chrest model is to refuse to learn.

      • setTemplateConstructionParameters

        public void setTemplateConstructionParameters(int minNodeDepthInNetworkToBeTemplate,
                                              int minItemOrPositionOccurrencesInNodeImagesToBeSlotValue)
        Set the parameters that control whether a Node, N, can be converted into a template.
        Parameters:
        minNodeDepthInNetworkToBeTemplate - How many Links must be between the Modality root Node of N and N itself before N can be a candidate for template conversion. Set to 3 by default, should be >= 1.
        minItemOrPositionOccurrencesInNodeImagesToBeSlotValue - The minimum number of times the result of invoking ItemSquarePattern.getItem(), I, or the result of packaging ItemSquarePattern.getColumn() and ItemSquarePattern.getRow() as a Square, S, on the image of N must occur in the images of the child Nodes of N before N can be a candidate for template conversion and I/S can be a slot value for N. Set to 2 by default, should be >= 1.

      • getContentSizeCounts

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> getContentSizeCounts(int time)
        Parameters:
        time -
        Returns:
        A map of invoking ListPattern.size() on the result of invoking Node.getContents() on every Node of every Modality in long-term memory at the time specified together with their frequency of occurrence.

        For example, if there are 6 Nodes in total in long-term memory and their contents are: 

         Node 1: <[H 0 2]>
 Node 2: <[T 0 1]>
 Node 3: <[H -2 1]>
 Node 4: <[H 0 2][H 0 1][T 1 0]]>
 Node 5: <[H 2 0][O 2 1][T 0 2]]>
 Node 6: <[H 0 1][H 0 2][T 2 0][O -1 -1]>
        Then the Map returned would be: 
         1 => 3,
 3 => 2,
 4 => 1

      • getImageSizeCounts

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> getImageSizeCounts(int time)
        Parameters:
        time -
        Returns:
        A map of invoking ListPattern.size() on the result of invoking Node.getImage(int) on every Node of every Modality in long-term memory at the time specified together with their frequency of occurrence.

        For example, if there are 6 Nodes in total in long-term memory and their images are: 

         Node 1: <[H 0 2]>
 Node 2: <[T 0 1]>
 Node 3: <[H -2 1]>
 Node 4: <[H 0 2][H 0 1][T 1 0]]>
 Node 5: <[H 2 0][O 2 1][T 0 2]]>
 Node 6: <[H 0 1][H 0 2][T 2 0][O -1 -1]>
        Then the Map returned would be: 
         1 => 3,
 3 => 2,
 4 => 1

      • addEpisodeToExecutionHistory

        public void addEpisodeToExecutionHistory(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> columnNamesAndValues)
        Adds an episode to the execution history table of this model's database connection. This function performs the following operations:
        1. If a value for the "TIME" column has not been specified, its value for this row is set to the value of the "TIME" column in the last row inserted.
        2. Creates and executes the SQLite statement that performs the insert.
        3. Updates the last inserted row structure for this model instance.
        Parameters:
        columnNamesAndValues - The column names and values that should be added to this model's execution history. Any columns whose values have not been specified will have blank values inserted automatically. To ensure consistency of operation, specify column names (keys) using this class' relevant class members (static variables whose names start with "_historyTable" and end with "ColumnName").

      • recogniseAndLearn

        public ChrestStatus recogniseAndLearn(ListPattern pattern,
                                      int time)
        Sort the ListPattern provided through the long-term memory network of #this (see #recognise( jchrest.lib.ListPattern, int)), add the {@link jchrest.architecture.Node} recognised to the relevant {@link jchrest.architecture.Stm} {@link jchrest.lib.Modality} and learn the {@link jchrest.lib.ListPattern} if the image of the {@link jchrest.architecture.Node} recognised does not exactly match the {@link jchrest.lib.ListPattern} provided.
        Parameters:
        pattern -
        time -
        Returns:
        • jchrest.lib.Status#COGNITION_BUSY if the cognitive resource of #this is busy at the time specified.
        • jchrest.lib.Status#INPUT_ALREADY_LEARNED if the pattern specified causes the recognition of a Node from long-term memory that returns pattern when Node.getImage(int) is invoked on it.
        • jchrest.lib.Status#LEARNING_REFUSED if #this randomly refuses to learn even if the pattern retrieves a Node from long-term memory that doesn't return pattern when Node.getImage(int) is invoked on it.
        • jchrest.lib.Status#DISCRIMINATION_SUCCESSFUL if discrimination is attempted and is successful.
        • jchrest.lib.Status#DISCRIMINATION_FAILED if discrimination is attempted but fails.
        • jchrest.lib.Status#FAMILIARISATION_SUCCESSFUL if familiarisation is attempted and is successful.
        • jchrest.lib.Status#FAMILIARISATION_FAILED if familiarisation is attempted but fails.

      • recognise

        public Node recognise(ListPattern pattern,
                      java.lang.Integer time,
                      java.lang.Boolean considerTimeAndAddRecognisedNodeToStm)
        Retrieves the Node reached after sorting the ListPattern provided through the long-term memory of #this vertically, then horizontally. If a non-root Node is retrieved, it is placed into the relevant Stm Modality based on the result of invoking Node.getModality() on the Node retrieved. Modifies the cognition and attention clocks.
        Parameters:
        pattern -
        time -
        considerTimeAndAddRecognisedNodeToStm -
        Returns:
        If considerTimeAndAddRecognisedNodeToStm is set to Boolean.FALSE or if its set to Boolean.TRUE and isCognitionFree(int) returns Boolean.TRUE when time is passed as a parameter, the Node reached (as explained in the parameter description above) is returned. This may be a root Node.

        If considerTimeAndAddRecognisedNodeToStm is set to Boolean.TRUE and isCognitionFree(int) returns Boolean.FALSE when time is passed as a parameter, null is returned.

      • learnProduction

        public ChrestStatus learnProduction(ListPattern vision,
                                    ListPattern action,
                                    int time)
        Attempts to learn a production between the vision and action specified. To learn a production, the following statements must all evaluate to Boolean.TRUE:
        1. #this must exist at the time specified.
        2. The attention of #this must be free at the time specified.
        3. The vision and action specified must return Modality.VISUAL and Modality.ACTION respectively when ListPattern.getModality() is invoked on them.
        4. The vision and action specified must be present in Modality.VISUAL and Modality.ACTION Stm at the time specified, i.e. a non-null and non-empty List must be returned by searchStm(jchrest.lib.ListPattern, int) when the vision and action specified are passed as parameters.
        5. The cognition of #this must be free after Modality.VISUAL and Modality.ACTION Stm have been searched for the visualNode and actionNode specified.
        After invoking searchStm(jchrest.lib.ListPattern, int), the Nodes selected for use in the production to be learned may not return Boolean.TRUE when Node.getImage(int) is compared to the vision or action using ListPattern.equals(java.lang.Object). Thus, "over-generalisation" can occur in such scenarios. For example, in Tileworld, the vision passed may be <[T 0 1][H 1 1][H 0 2]> and the action passed may be to push the tile ahead north, i.e. <[PT 0 1]>. However, if <[T 0 1][H 1 1][H 0 2]> is not exactly represented by a Node in Stm but <[T 0 1][H 1 1]> is, the production learned will be equal to "whenever a tile can be seen on the square immediately ahead and a hole can be seen to the right of the tile, push the tile north" rather than "whenever a tile can be seen on the square immediately ahead and two holes can be seen, one to the right of the tile and the other north of the tile, push the tile north". This method may consume the attentional and cognitive resources of #this:
        • If attention is free at the time specified, attention is consumed according to the documentation for searchStm(jchrest.lib.ListPattern, int).
        • Cognition is consumed if an attempt to learn a production is successful. The actual time cognition is consumed until is equal to the time the searchStm(jchrest.lib.ListPattern, int) completes plus the value returned by #this#getAddProductionTime().
        Parameters:
        visualNode -
        actionNode -
        time -
        Returns:
        The following conditions will cause the following ChrestStatus to be returned (note that conditions are cumulative, i.e. when checking the second condition, the first condition does not apply):
        1. If #this does not exist at the time specified, ChrestStatus.MODEL_DOES_NOT_EXIST_AT_TIME is returned.
        2. If isAttentionFree(int) returns Boolean.FALSE when invoked in context of #this and time is specified as a parameter, ChrestStatus.ATTENTION_BUSY is returned.
        3. If searchStm(jchrest.lib.ListPattern, int) does not return a Node whose contents match the vision specified, ChrestStatus.VISION_NOT_IN_STM is returned.
        4. If searchStm(jchrest.lib.ListPattern, int) does return a Node whose contents match the vision specified, but does not return a Node whose contents match the action specified, ChrestStatus.ACTION_NOT_IN_STM is returned.
        5. See return values for jchrest.architecture.Node#addProduction(jchrest.architecture.Node, java.lang.Double, int). If ChrestStatus.LEARN_PRODUCTION_SUCCESSFUL is returned, ChrestStatus.EXACT_PRODUCTION_LEARNED is returned if invoking Node.getImage(int) on the Nodes selected for the production returns Boolean.TRUE when compared to both the vision and action specified. Otherwise, ChrestStatus.OVERGENERALISED_PRODUCTION_LEARNED is returned.

      • reinforceProduction

        public ChrestStatus reinforceProduction(ListPattern vision,
                                        ListPattern action,
                                        java.lang.Double[] variables,
                                        int time)
        In order for a production to be reinforced, the production to reinforce must first be identified. To do this, the source Node, denoted V*, and terminus Node, denoted A*, must be identified using the vision and action specified. Setting V* is done by first getting the result of invoking searchStm(jchrest.lib.ListPattern, int) on Modality.VISUAL Stm and passing the vision and time specified as parameters. The result is then filtered to create a set of candidates, denoted V, that cause the following statements to all evaluate to Boolean.TRUE:
        1. Node's image equals or matches the vision after searchStm(jchrest.lib.ListPattern, int) has been invoked (see Node.getImage(int), ListPattern.equals(java.lang.Object) and ListPattern.matches(jchrest.lib.Pattern)).
        2. Node contains productions after searchStm(jchrest.lib.ListPattern, int) has been invoked (see Node.getProductions(int)).
        Each element of V, v is then checked how closely its image matches the vision specified: if v's image equals the vision specified, it is set to be V*. If no v has an image that equals the vision specified, the v that matches the vision specified the most is set to be V*.

        Setting A* is done by first creating a set, denoted A, of all Modality.ACTION Nodes that are productions in V* which cause all the following statements to evaluate to Boolean.TRUE:

        1. Invoking isNodeInStm(jchrest.architecture.Node, int, boolean) returns Boolean.TRUE when the Modality.ACTION Node, current time and Boolean.FALSE are passed as parameters (attention is not consumed when checking if the Modality.ACTION Node is in Modality.ACTION Stm).
        2. Modality.ACTION Node's image equals or matches the action (see Node.getImage(int), ListPattern.equals(java.lang.Object) and ListPattern.matches(jchrest.lib.Pattern)).
        Each element of A, a is then checked how closely its image matches the action specified: if a's image equals the action specified, it is set to be A*. If no a has an image that equals the action specified, the a that matches the action specified the most is set to be A*.

        As can be inferred from reading the algorithms for selecting V* and A* above, there is a preference ordering on what Nodes are selected to be V* and A* according to how closely the images of elements in V and A match the vision and action specified. Explicitly, this preference ordering is:

        1. An exact match: Invoking Node.getImage(int) on a Node in V causes ListPattern.equals(java.lang.Object) to evaluate to Boolean.TRUE when vision is passed as a parameter. Similarly, invoking Node.getImage(int) on a Node in A causes ListPattern.equals(java.lang.Object) to evaluate to Boolean.TRUE when action is passed as a parameter.
        2. A high match: Invoking Node.getImage(int) on a Node in V causes ListPattern.equals(java.lang.Object) to evaluate to Boolean.TRUE when vision is passed as a parameter. However, ListPattern.equals(java.lang.Object) does not return Boolean.TRUE when passed the result of invoking Node.getImage(int) on any of the Nodes in A together with the action specified. Instead, ListPattern.matches(jchrest.lib.Pattern) returns Boolean.TRUE when passed the result of invoking Node.getImage(int) on any of the Nodes in A together with the action specified.
        3. A moderate match: ListPattern.equals(java.lang.Object) does not return Boolean.TRUE when passed the result of invoking Node.getImage(int) on any of the Nodes in V together with the vision specified. Instead, ListPattern.matches(jchrest.lib.Pattern) returns Boolean.TRUE when passed the result of invoking Node.getImage(int) on any of the Nodes in V together with the vision specified. Conversely, invoking Node.getImage(int) on a Node in A causes ListPattern.equals(java.lang.Object) to evaluate to Boolean.TRUE when action is passed as a parameter.
        4. A low match: ListPattern.equals(java.lang.Object) does not return Boolean.TRUE when passed the result of invoking Node.getImage(int) on any of the Nodes in V together with the vision specified. Instead, ListPattern.matches(jchrest.lib.Pattern) returns Boolean.TRUE when passed the result of invoking Node.getImage(int) on any of the Nodes in V together with the vision specified. The same is also true for the Nodes in A.
        In normal operation circumstances, no two Nodes in V or A should return Boolean.TRUE when the result of invoking Node.getImage(int) and the vision or action specified are passed as parameters to ListPattern.equals(java.lang.Object). However, if this is ever the case, V* would be set to the first Node in Modality.VISUAL Stm that causes the condition stipulated to evaluate to Boolean.TRUE whereas A* would be the first Node in A (first production in V*) that causes the condition stipulated to evaluate to Boolean.TRUE.

        With regard to any match other than an equal match, there may be multiple jchrest.architecture.Nodes in V or A that cause ListPattern.matches(jchrest.lib.Pattern) to evaluate to Boolean.TRUE. In this case, the Node selected will be the first one encountered that matches the vision or action passed the most. For example, given a vision of <[T 0 1][H 0 2][O 2 0]> and 3 Nodes encountered in the order x, y and z whose contents are equal to <[T 0 1]>, <[T 0 1][H 0 2]> and <[T 0 1][H 0 2]> respectively, Node y would become V* since two of the PrimitivePatterns in its contents match the vision input and, despite this also being true for Node z, Node y is encountered before z.

        Invoking this function may consume the attentional and cognitive resources of #this:

        • Checking if the vision passed is present in Modality.VISUAL Stm consumes attention. The attentional time cost incurred is equal to that detailed in searchStm(jchrest.lib.ListPattern, int) for each Node present in Modality.VISUAL Stm.
        • Cognition is consumed since reinforcing a production requires time. If V* and A* are identified, cognition will be consumed until the attentional time cost specified above plus the time specified by #this#getReinforceProductionTime().
        Parameters:
        vision - If invoking ListPattern.getModality() on this does not return Modality.VISUAL, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        action - If invoking ListPattern.getModality() on this does not return Modality.ACTION, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        variables - The variables required by the result of #this#getReinforcementLearningTheory() to invoke ReinforcementLearning.Theory.calculateReinforcementValue( java.lang.Double[]).
        time -
        Returns:
        A ChrestStatus. Note that, for the ChrestStatus to be returned by a statement, all previous statements must not have returned a ChrestStatus:
        • If #this#getCreationTime() is less than the time specified, ChrestStatus.MODEL_DOES_NOT_EXIST_AT_TIME is returned.
        • If #this#isAttentionFree(int) returns Boolean.FALSE when passed the time specified, ChrestStatus.ATTENTION_BUSY is returned.
        • If V* or A* are not identified, ChrestStatus.NO_PRODUCTION_IDENTIFIED is returned.
        • If #this#isCognitionFree(int) returns Boolean.FALSE after V* and A* have been identified, ChrestStatus.COGNITION_BUSY is returned.
        • If reinforcing the production between V* and A* fails, ChrestStatus.PRODUCTION_REINFORCEMENT_FAILED is returned.
        • If reinforcing the production between V* and A* succeeds, one of the following is returned depending on the type of production reinforced:
          • Exact production match: ChrestStatus.EXACT_PRODUCTION_MATCH_REINFORCED.
          • High production match: ChrestStatus.HIGH_PRODUCTION_MATCH_REINFORCED.
          • Moderate production match: ChrestStatus.MODERATE_PRODUCTION_MATCH_REINFORCED.
          • Low production match: ChrestStatus.LOW_PRODUCTION_MATCH_REINFORCED.

      • getStmItem

        public Node getStmItem(Modality stmModality,
                       int index,
                       int time)
        Attempts to retrieve the Node from the index specified at the time specified from the Stm Modality specified.

        If successful, this method will consume the attention resource of #this according to the following equation where A is the attention clock of #this, t is the time specified, r is the result of #this#getTimeToRetrieveItemFromStm() and i is the index specified.

        A = t + (r * i)

        Parameters:
        stmModality -
        index - Non-zero indexed, i.e. if the first Node in the stmModality specified is required, pass 1.
        time -
        Returns:
        null if any of the following statements evaluate to Boolean.TRUE. Otherwise, the Node in the index specified at the time specified in the Stm Modality specified by stmModality is returned.
        • #this does not exist at the time specified.
        • #this#isAttentionFree(int) returns Boolean.FALSE at the time specified.
        • The index specified is greater than the number of Nodes in the Stm Modality specified at the time specified.

      • searchStm

        public java.util.List<Node> searchStm(ListPattern pattern,
                                      int time)
        Invokes Stm.getContents(int) on the Stm Modality of the pattern specified and searches the Nodes returned for any whose Node.getContents() result matches the pattern specified. If isAttentionFree(int) returns Boolean.TRUE at the time specified and invoking Stm.getContents(int) on the Stm Modality of the pattern specified returns some Nodes, attention will be consumed until some time A. A will equal the time specified, T, plus the product of the number of Nodes returned, N, multiplied by the total of the time taken to retrieve a Node from Stm, R, plus the time taken to compare a Node, C. As an equation: A = T + (N * (R + C))
        Parameters:
        pattern -
        time -
        Returns:
        If isAttentionFree(int) returns Boolean.FALSE, null is returned.

        If Nodes match the condition stated above, a List of these Nodes will be returned.

        If no Nodes match the condition stated above, an empty List will be returned.

      • replaceStmHypothesis

        public void replaceStmHypothesis(Node replacement,
                                 int time)
        Modifies the attention clock of #this. If the attention resource is free at the time this function is requested, the hypothesis (the first Node in a Stm modality) in the relevant Stm modality associated with #this is replaced with the Node specified. The time the new hypothesis is added to the relevant Stm, t, is equal to the time this function is invoked plus the time specified to add update short-term memory (see getTimeToUpdateStm()). The attention clock of #this will also be set to t.
        Parameters:
        replacement -
        time -

      • generateActionUsingVisualPatternRecognition

        public Node[] generateActionUsingVisualPatternRecognition(int time)
        Selects an Modality.ACTION Node that is linked to from a production contained in one of the Modality.VISUAL Nodes currently in Modality.VISUAL Stm.

        The Modality.ACTION Node selected is selected using two rounds of RouletteWheelSelection. The first round considers all Modality.VISUAL Nodes currently in Modality.VISUAL Stm that contain productions. These Modality.VISUAL Nodes are selected between based upon their total information content, i.e. the result of invoking ListPattern.size() on the result of invoking Node.getAllInformation(int) on them. Therefore, Modality.VISUAL Nodes that are better known have a greater chance of being selected. After selecting a Modality.VISUAL Node, its productions are selected between based upon their values.

        NOTE: the attention of this Chrest model must be free at time otherwise, pattern-recognition can not occur. If attention if free, the attention of this Chrest model will be consumed from time until the result of getTimeToRetrieveItemFromStm() multiplied by the number of Nodes in Modality.VISUAL Stm.

        Returns:
        A two-element Node Array. If no Modality.VISUAL or Modality.ACTION Node can be selected, both elements will equal null. Otherwise, the first element will equal the Modality.VISUAL Node selected and the second element will equal the Modality.ACTION Node selected.

      • makeTemplates

        public void makeTemplates(int time)
        Instruct #this to create templates throughout the entirety of its visual long-term memory modality at the time specified. Templates will only be created if all the following statements are true:
        • #this is "alive" at the time specified.
        • #this can construct templates.
        • The cognition resource of #this is free at the time specified.
        This function is usually called at the end of a training session that #this has been engaged in but can be called as #this is interacting with the external domain. NOTE: currently, the template construction process only works for Modality.VISUAL Nodes that have ItemSquarePattern images.
        Parameters:
        time -

      • scheduleOrMakeNextFixation

        public ChrestStatus scheduleOrMakeNextFixation(Scene scene,
                                               boolean clearVisualStmIfNewFixationSetStarts,
                                               boolean constructVisualSpatialField,
                                               int time)
        Creates/performs Fixations in accordance with #this#getDomainSpecifics(), the scene specified and the time specified. After initialising a new Fixation set, it is imperative that this method is called every millisecond in isolation until Boolean.TRUE is returned.

        The method proceeds by invoking the following functions in the order specified:

        1. getInitialFixation(int)
        2. performScheduledFixations(java.util.List, jchrest.domainSpecifics.Scene, int)
        3. jchrest.architecture.Chrest#tagVisualSpatialFieldObjectsFixatedOnAsRecognised(jchrest.domainSpecifics.Fixation)
        4. Check if {@link jchrest.domainSpecifics.Fixation} set is now complete, i.e. does the number of {@link jchrest.domainSpecifics.Fixation Fixations} performed equal the result of invoking {@link jchrest.domainSpecifics.DomainSpecifics#getMaximumFixationsInSet()} in context of {@link #this#getDomainSpecifics()} or does invoking {@link jchrest.domainSpecifics.DomainSpecifics#isFixationSetComplete(int)} in context of {@link #this#getDomainSpecifics()} return {@link java.lang.Boolean#TRUE}?
          • {@link jchrest.domainSpecifics.Fixation} set complete
            1. {@link jchrest.architecture.Chrest#tagUnrecognisedVisualSpatialFieldObjectsAfterFixationSetComplete(jchrest.domainSpecifics.Fixation)}
            2. {@link jchrest.architecture.Perceiver#learnFromNewFixations(int)} (in context of {@link #this#getPerceiver()}).
            3. If {@code constructVisualSpatialField} specifies {@link java.lang.Boolean#TRUE}, {@link jchrest.architecture.Chrest#constructVisualSpatialField(int)} is invoked.
          • {@link jchrest.domainSpecifics.Fixation} set not complete
            1. {@link jchrest.architecture.Chrest#scheduleFixationsForPerformance(java.util.List, int)
            2. {@link jchrest.architecture.Chrest#getNonInitialFixation(int, int, int)}
        Parameters:
        scene - The Scene that will be used to schedule or make a new Fixation.
        clearVisualStmIfNewFixationSetStarts -
        constructVisualSpatialField -
        time -
        Returns:
        A ChrestStatus as described below. Note that the statements below are cumulative, i.e. the second statement is only applicable if the first isn't.
        1. ChrestStatus.MODEL_DOES_NOT_EXIST_AT_TIME if #this does not exist at the time specified.
        2. ChrestStatus.NO_FIXATION_SET_BEING_PERFORMED if #this is/can not performing a Fixation set at the time specified.
        3. ChrestStatus.NO_FIXATION_SET_BEING_PERFORMED if #this is/can not performing a Fixation set at the time specified.
        4. ChrestStatus.FIXATION_SET_BEING_PERFORMED if #this is performing a Fixation set at the time specified.
        5. ChrestStatus.FIXATION_SET_COMPLETE if #this has just performed a complete Fixation set at the time specified.

      • getFixationPerformed

        public Fixation getFixationPerformed(int index,
                                     int time)
        Attempts to retrieve Fixation at the index specified from the result of invoking Perceiver.getFixationsPerformed(int) at the time specified.

        If successful, this method will consume the attention resource of #this according to the following equation where A is the attention clock of #this, t is the time specified, r is the result of #this#getTimeToRetrieveFixationFromPerceiver() and i is the index specified.

        A = t + (r * i)

        Parameters:
        index - Non-zero indexed. Since the most recent Fixation performed should be retrieved quicker than the first Fixation performed, specifying 1 for this parameter will retrieve the most recent Fixation performed.
        time -
        Returns:
        null if any of the following statements evaluate to Boolean.TRUE. Otherwise, the Fixation performed at the index specified at the time specified is returned.
        • #this does not exist at the time specified.
        • #this#isAttentionFree(int) returns Boolean.FALSE at the time specified.
        • The index specified is greater than the result of invoking List.size() on the result of invoking Perceiver.getFixationsPerformed(int) at the time specified.

      • moveObjectsInVisualSpatialField

        public void moveObjectsInVisualSpatialField(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<ItemSquarePattern>> moveSequences,
                                            int time,
                                            boolean incurAccessTimeCost)
                                     throws VisualSpatialFieldException
        Moves VisualSpatialFieldObjects on the VisualSpatialField present at the time specified according to the moveSequences specified.

        VisualSpatialFieldObject movement can only occur if the attention of #this is free. If all moves are successful, the attention clock of #this will be set to the sum of #this#getTimeToAccessVisualSpatialField() and the number of moves performed multiplied by #this#getTimeToMoveVisualSpatialFieldObject().

        The number of Squares moved by a VisualSpatialFieldObject is not constrained by this method. Therefore, according to this method, it takes the same amount of time to move a VisualSpatialFieldObject across 5 Squares as it does to move it across 1. Any movement constraints of this sort should be denoted by the moves specified.

        If a VisualSpatialFieldObject is moved to a Square on a VisualSpatialField that is already occupied then the two VisualSpatialFieldObjects will co-exist on the Square unless the square contains a VisualSpatialFieldObject whose SceneObject.getObjectType() is equal to Scene.getEmptySquareToken() or VisualSpatialFieldObject.getUnknownSquareToken().

        VisualSpatialFieldObject movement occurs in two phases: "pick-up" and "put-down". In both phases, any VisualSpatialFieldObjects on coordinates that fall within Perceiver.getFixationFieldOfView() on the relevant VisualSpatialField around the VisualSpatialFieldObject being moved will have their termini refreshed since attention will be focused upon them.

        Note that the function will handle VisualSpatialFieldObject movement to coordinates not represented in the relevant VisualSpatialField gracefully, i.e. if a VisualSpatialFieldObject is moved to coordinates outside the range encoded by the relevant VisualSpatialField and subsequent moves have been specified in moveSequences, these will not be implemented and the next jchrest.architecture.VisualSpatialFieldObject move sequence will be processed (if present).

        Parameters:
        moveSequences - A 2D List whose first dimension elements should contain Lists of ItemSquarePatterns that prescribe a sequence of moves for one VisualSpatialFieldObject using coordinates relative to the VisualSpatialField it is located on. It is imperative that:
        1. The first ItemSquarePattern specifies the current location of the VisualSpatialFieldObject to move.
        2. VisualSpatialFieldObjects are identified using their identifier (see SceneObject.getIdentifier()) rather than their type (see jchrest.lib.VisualSpatialFieldObject#getObjectClass()).
        For example, if two VisualSpatialFieldObjects return the same value for jchrest.lib.VisualSpatialFieldObject#getObjectClass() ("A", for example) but have different results for SceneObject.getIdentifier() ("0" and "1", for example) and both are to be moved, "0" before "1", then the List passed should be of the form:

        { {[0 sourceX sourceY], [0 destinationX desitinationY]}, {[1 sourceX sourceY], [1 desitinationX destinationY]} }

        time - The current time (in milliseconds) in the domain when VisualSpatialFieldObject;movement is requested.
        incurAccessTimeCost - Set to Boolean.TRUE to incur an attentional time cost equal to #this#getTimeToAccessVisualSpatialField() when processing the moveSequence specified, set to Boolean.FALSE otherwise. This is useful for situations where the moveSequence specified is part of a larger sequence but each move must be processed individually and the validity of the resulting visual-spatial field state checked before processing the next moveSequence.
        Throws:
        VisualSpatialFieldException - If moveSequences cause any of the following statements to evaluate to Boolean.TRUE:
        1. More than one VisualSpatialFieldObject is moved within the same sequence; object movement should be strictly serial. Therefore, whereas {{[0 1 1][0 2 2]}{[1 2 3][1 4 5]}} is valid, {{[0 1 1][5 2 2]}{[1 2 3][1 4 5]}} is not since an attempt is made to move "5" during "0"s movement specification.
        2. The initial ItemSquarePattern in a move sequence does not correctly identify where the VisualSpatialFieldObject is located.
        3. Only the initial location of a VisualSpatialFieldObject is specified.
